sentence.text: Herein, we report that eye development expression was significantly down-regulated in gastric cancer tissues and associated with poor survival.
In vitro, eye development knockdown promoted tumor cell proliferation and migration through BMPR II by activating Akt, Erk and b-catenin.
Furthermore, we observed the hypermethylation of the eye development promoter in gastric cancer, which induced low expression of CHRDL1 and decreased its secretion to the supernatant.
Finally, in vivo experiments confirmed that eye development acted as a tumor suppressor gene in suppressing tumor growth and metastasis
